newsitem.title: USA: Danka ADRs soar on Kodak deal.
newsitem.headline: Danka ADRs soar on Kodak deal.

text.p: U.S. ADRs of Danka Business Systems Plc soared Monday morning after Danka announced it was buying Eastman Kodak Co's office copier business for $684 million.
Danka ADRs jumped 5-3/8 to 35-1/4. With 1.2 million ADRs traded, it was the fifth busiest stock on Nasdaq.
Since June 26, when Danka said first-quarter earnings would be below market expectations, the ADRs have languished, falling as low as 24, then trading at or below 30.
Kodak shares were off 1/4 to 72. The stock opened higher, adding 1/2, before reversing course.
"I get a ho-hum for Kodak," said Thomas O'Brien, head trader for domestic equities at Guzman & Co.
"I don't think the market has much interest in the deal for Kodak," said Kenneth Ducey, director of trading at BT Brokerage.
The deal calls for Danka to buy the sales, marketing and equipment service functions of Kodak's Office Imaging business, as well as the facilities management business known as Kodak Imaging Services.
Kodak said the deal would help its earnings after an initial book loss of about $250 million after-tax.
Kodak said it would retain and continue to operate the manufacturing and research and development operations supporting Office Imaging.
